comments:
Build: I20070320-0010

1) Installed the build
2) Help > Software Updates > Find new Features to Install
3) Select Europa discovery site
4) Select all features

-> There is a message that corona must be installed separately.

5) Click the checkbox next to "Communication Tools" to deselect.

-> Error occurs:

Correction: the error occurs when you click the "twistie" to expand the tree, not by clicking the checkbox.
This one is at least major because it affects the users' ability to use the update manager to get Europa features.

Boris, I could not reproduce this problem with I20070320-0010. These are my observations: 

1) I used 'Europa discovery site', not a mirror (bottom of the list)
2) When I select everything, it takes a while to finish validation. This is because digests are not used at the moment. Adding webmaster: digests need to be built again if we want decent browsing performance.
3) When I deselect 'Collaboration Tools', I get another message about SOA missing org.apache.cxf plug-in
4) When I deselect 'SOA' category, I am error-free. 
5) When I press 'Next', the wizard becomes very tall due to the many features in the list on the left. This is trivial and needs to be fixed.
6) When I accept license and press 'Next', I get the tall wizard again with many features, all going into the same install location. This is ok (again, height needs to be fixed). However, very few features report download sizes. We should ask people to start reporting them.

Is there something special I need to do to get NPE (pick a select mirror or something)?
I fixed license and install page heights and released them now.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Boris, I could not reproduce this problem with I20070320-0010. These are my
> observations: 
> 
> 1) I used 'Europa discovery site', not a mirror (bottom of the list)
> 2) When I select everything, it takes a while to finish validation. This is
> because digests are not used at the moment. Adding webmaster: digests need to
> be built again if we want decent browsing performance.
> 3) When I deselect 'Collaboration Tools', I get another message about SOA
> missing org.apache.cxf plug-in

Try expanding "Collaboration Tools" instead of deselecting it, and check your error log or run in debug mode with an exception breakpoint for NullPointerException.

Nope, sorry. I tried it with the newer build (1620) from home (direct connection). It was slower (expected) but no NPEs in the long.

The only difference I can see is that you are using Vista, and I am using XP. I will try it tomorrow on Vista.

I saw this on Windows XP, John on Vista; I don't think that the OS matters.  Ping me tomorrow if you need help reproducing this.

> 1) I used 'Europa discovery site', not a mirror (bottom of the list)

I used the Ottawa mirror, not sure if this has an effect.

For some reason the choice of mirror *does* matter. I tried to reproduce today using the eclipse.org update site, but could not reproduce.  I can still reproduce today with the Ottawa mirror.  Steps:

1) When the wizard opens, click the top level checkbox for "Europa Discovery Site"
2) Expand the "Europa Discovery Site" tree node.
3) Try to expand "Collaboration Tools"

-> Several NPEs in log file.

Perhaps the ottawa mirror is in some strange state?
Could be; from work, I use Toronto mirror. I also tried it from home (direct to eclipse.org) and it also worked.

It appears we have already fixed this problem in 3.2.2, but didn't merge the fix into HEAD. I have done it for 4:30pm build. Please check later - I don't see the problem any more with the merged code anywhere (including Ottawa mirror).
